definition[0]: not considering yourself or your ideas to be as important as other people’s
definition[1]: having a low social class or position
example[1]: He started his career as a humble peanut farmer.
example[2]: Iacocca rose from humble beginnings to become boss of Ford.
definition[2]: simple and ordinary, but useful or effective
example[3]: The humble potato may be the key to feeding the world’s population.
definition[3]: to easily defeat someone who is much stronger than you are
example[4]: The mighty U.S. army was humbled by a small Southeast Asian country.
